abstract: Joseph Chait pleads guilty in New York City court to conspiring to smuggle wildlife products, including ivory and coral; Chait, auction house official from Beverly Hills, Calif, faces maximum of 10 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors said that Joseph Chait, who works in California, falsely claimed on customs forms that items made of rhinoceros horn or elephant ivory were made of bone, wood or plastic.

headline.main: Auction Official Pleads Guilty in Scheme to Smuggle Wildlife Products Worth $1 Million
headline.print_headline: Man Pleads Guilty in Ivory Scheme

snippet: Prosecutors said that Joseph Chait, who works in California, falsely claimed on customs forms that items made of rhinoceros horn or elephant ivory were made of bone, wood or plastic.
